characters: EXT. ROAD TO THE BEACH. DAY
INT. HOLIDAY VILLAGE REC ROOM. EVENING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grim region where the sky hangs low and the wind can knock a man off his feet. On the side of the highway, a large, muscular man with spiked blond hair: Ali Van Versh, 25. He has a big bag in one hand and a cell phone in the othe He talks on the phone as he continues walking:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. It's Ali... I left. I took the kid with me. She can't take care of him anymore. I got into a fight with the guy she's with. I don't know where to go. What do I do with the kid? I can't talk. I don't have any more credit... Call me back! He hangs up quickly and turns to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it! His phone rings. He immediately answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Where is it? Shit! It's so far! How do I get there? I don't know. Today or tomorrow. Yeah... Ali lifts Sam onto his shoulders with one arm. Sam is tin he looks like a squirrel on his father's back. 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a map of the French rail system near the toilets in a regional train. While Sam pees, Ali examines it. He follows the lines to plot out their trip. He arrives wher France ends, at the Mediterranean. Sam comes out of the bathroom, straightening his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have any money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thirsty!

dialogues.speaker: INT. TGV. DAY
dialogues.text: A different speed, different countryside. Ali notices a half-empty bottle of Evian water left on a tray. He takes it. He searches through the garbage under other empty seats. Ali and Sam eat leftover sandwiches and fruit, and finish off abandoned bottles of water.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TGV. DAY
dialogues.text: Another TGV. Rain evaporates off the windows. Ali has fallen asleep. He's too big for his seat. Sam watches the landscape go by and bangs his feet against his seat. Ali opens one eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it. Sam's Mickey Mouse sandals pause, then go back to their banging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said to stop it. The sandals freeze. Cut. 3

dialogues.speaker: THE CHILD
dialogues.text: All of a sudden, Sam is asleep, his eyelids blinking quickly.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CANNES STREET. DAY
dialogues.text: Ali's face is turned toward the orange heat of an afterno sun. Ali and Sam look at the sea, the beaches and hotels. It's hot and beautiful. They walk by tanned people in shorts, short skirts, sandals... In their shapeless grey track pants, they look like hoboe Ali drags his sport bag with one hand and Sam with the other. Ali is on the phone: ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. A big street that started at the station. Yeah, by the beach. Behind? We just came from there! Ali pulls Sam away from one of the stairways that lead to the beach... SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I. He's coming to pick us up. Come on! Sam is extenuated. Ali has to heave him up onto a shoulde

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CANNES STREET. DAY
dialogues.text: A four-lane avenue near the outskirts of town. Ali is walking on the shoulder of the road, with Sam pigg back. A horn beeps. A refrigerated truck, blinking to get to the side of the road. The window rolls down to reveal moustache and a cap: Richard. 4

dialogues.speaker: INT. RICHARD'S TRUCK. DAY
dialogues.text: While driving... RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Southern accent)... A couple miles back I saw a blond guy. (Imitates screeching brakes) I stop short! "You Ali?" I ask. He says "No, me Kurt". Another few hundred feet, another big blond guy! (Screech) I ask "You Ali?" again. This time I didn't even understand what he answered. Another few hundred feet... Ten of them! Ten! Every Kraut and Flemish guy on the coast! So I go call your sister... Ali is thrown for a loop. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncertain) You kidding? RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ali) Is he a little crazy? RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sam) What? You don't like my truck? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I do. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pretending to be shocked) He doesn't like my truck! SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do too like it! Worked up, Sam shrieks, holding his hands over his ears: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) I like your truck! The road hugs the seashore. Ali watches beaches, homes, a railway line pass by... Voice over, we hear Richard's 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: distant voice.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SUBURBAN KITCHEN. DAY
dialogues.text: A kitchen with mismatched furnishings. China and cheesy wallpaper. Sam devours the cookies and Coke that Richard gives him. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all got fired after some Spanish guy bought out the trucking company... Eight truckers. I thought it over, discussed it with your sister and figured I could do it on my own. So I bought this truck with my severance pay... Ali has finished his cream cheese sandwiches. He gets up and opens the old fridge. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops, poor man, not those! She'll kill you! Start with the expired ones, on the top shelf! They're organized by date. First the top shelf, then move down.... Anna brings it home from the supermarket where she works. As soon as they reach their expiration date, those idiots throw it all away, even if you can still eat it for a week! (to Sam) You want some more?

dialogues.speaker: INT. SUBURBAN HOME. DAY
dialogues.text: Anna empties Sam's Spiderman bag onto the table, spilling out old, dirty, crumpled clothes. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a hint of Southern accent) Is this all you have for him? Anna Van Versh, Ali's sister, is in her thirties. She is huge woman, very tall with a pretty face. She wears leggings that make her ass look like a workhorse's and a pair of flip flops. At the bottom of the bag, Anna finds passport and opens it. It is Sam's. 6     ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She remembered his passport! ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't remember anything. It was already in there. She forgot about it, that's all. When they went to Amsterdam, they'd use the kid to smuggle dope... ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to be kidding! ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what she told me. Anna shakes her head in disbelief. A beat. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will you tend to the kid? I won't be able to all the time. I work, and so does Richard... Was he in school there? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know if your kid's in school? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, no. (turns to Sam) You in school? No answer. Sam is watching TV. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at your mom's place, did you go to school? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can try to enroll him at the school. I'll see... We also need to get him some clothes. He can't go like that... I'll ask the neighbors. (gives the child her hand) Come with me to 7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the backyard. I have to feed my babies.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GARDEN. EVENING
dialogues.text: Evening is falling. At the back of the garden are a home- made pen and doghouse. Four puppies come running. Sam touches them through the chicken wire. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to pet them? She lifts Sam up over the wire mesh. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. Don't step on their tiny paws. They're just babies. Anna shows him how to feed puppies, then stands back up. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ali) The breeder's picking them up next month. Brings in some money. Otherwise, Richard and I were thinking 300 a month for you and the kid... That okay? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Yeah" what? Is that too much? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not too much, but I don't have it. I had to pay for the train... ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you going to do? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Find a job. Whatever. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, whatever... You think there's any work around here? You think there's any more here than there? Where has that ever been the case? When you told me you were coming down, 8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said we couldn't afford houseguests! ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should I have done with the kid? Where should I have gone? ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea, but if you stay here you have to pay your share, or else go somewhere else. As far as we're concerned, it's easy: we can't! How long were you thinking of staying? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. She makes a tired gesture and goes back toward the house, calling Richard on the way. Ali hears Sam in the kennel, giggling in delight. He looks around: the seedy garden, a metal shed leaning t one side, what's left of an engine, an old, orange Specia 50 moped, plastic junk, etc. Overhead, a plane descends on Nice, its landing lights shining.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BASEMENT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: In the cluttered basement, Sam is rolled up in a sleeping bag arranged on a pallet and watches his father repair th antique Special 50 moped by the light of a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ELECTRONIC GOODS SHOP. DAY
dialogues.text: Ali wanders through an electronic goods shop, pretending be interested in cameras. Through the shop window, he can see Sam waiting outside in the sun.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ANTIBES STREETS. DAY
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Sam sees his father run out of the shop, trying to shake a security guard hot on his tail. Sam watches th disappear into a tiny lane. Sam looks around a bit frightened. 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farther off, in a busy shopping districtâ¦ Ali forces his way through hordes of tourists. The securi guard grabs him by the hood and forces him up against a wall. They are both dripping with sweat and out of breath SECURITY GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unzip your jacket! Empty your pockets! Ali keeps his cool. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unzip it yourself! Ali struggles free and smiles at the guy invitingly. The guard tries to punch him. Ali dodges: The guard hesitates a moment, until Ali lets fly a right hook. The guard stumbles. A kick in the face sends him flying into a stall. Ali lifts his arms in victory for th benefit of the few, stunned passersby. He kisses his own biceps, does three steps of a moonwalk and saunters off.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ANTIBES STREETS. DAY
dialogues.text: Sam is walking along the street by the beach amid the terraces and ice-cream stores, looking for his father. Then he sees the moped at the far side of the parking lot where they had left it chained up. He walks toward it. A voice calls out. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Here I am! Ali crosses the street and kneels down in front of Sam wh is sniffling, tears in his eyes. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need to cry. I wouldn't have left you all alone. Ali unlocks the moped. 10

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ALLEYWAY. DAY
dialogues.text: In a small side street, Sam watches Ali sell a camera for few 20 Euro notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the beach, Ali and Sam eat some McDonald's. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you happy here? Sam nods. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you like the most at Auntie's? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all? Nothing else besides the dogs? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs and the truck. The house? Auntie? The ocean? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs and the truck. Ali nods. Sam watches his Dad's fat fingers assemble the plastic toy from his Happy Meal. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have it good here... Ali's fingers stop. Sam looks up to find his father watching some girls in swimsuits go by. They go for a swim, horsing around and making noise. 11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The logo is in the shape of a sheriff's badge and hangs over some filing cabinets on the wall of a modest office: "ALTA Securite". OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No criminal record? You never fucked up? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The boss is in his fifties. He sits behind some files. Hi hair is short and white, it looks like he's wearing a helmet. He is squeezed into a cheap suit and wearing a ti He stares at Ali. OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the truth? We'll be checking anyway... Ali nods. The owner reaches out. OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your papers... Ali hands him his tattered paper ID. The owner writes dow the number. Ali is 13-14 on the picture. OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was your last job? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked in a slaughterhouse. Not for long. It closed. OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever work in security? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I was a night watchman in a stadium for 6 months. Working for the city. In a parking lot too. I did replacements. 12     OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever do any combat sports? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karate, for 6 years. I even won Junior Division. And two years of boxing. Thai. OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave it up? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my trainer who gave up. OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He died. A beat. OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how are you physically? You stay in shape? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't smoke? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink? He shakes his head "no". The boss notes something in a file. 20. INT. ALTA SECURITY OFFICE. DAY. Anna and Sam are waiting outside the office. The owner kisses Anna on the cheek. He asks how Richard is doing, then shows them to the door. Anna looks proud to know him 13

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FEVER RAY. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Saturday evening. The door to the Fever Ray night club. Patrons wait, bouncers pick and choose. An imposing Caucasian maneuvers the red rope. Behind him, Ali Van Versch and Foued Latahoui, who looks like a lightweight boxer, guard the door. Ali wears a faded blue "ALTA Secu" jacket and stiff, matching pants. Looking well-groomed, Foued is wearing a white shirt and tie. Well-groomed. A group of girls passes through the security barrier. Fou acts like he's hesitating: FOUED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll let you through because I'm outnumbered. Four against one, I don't stand a chance! The girls smile and disappear inside. Ali watches them vanish. FOUED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say something nice, anything. That way, when they leave, they remember you and you can hit on them. If they're a little plastered, if things didn't go too well for them, you're there with a nice thing to say... ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it works? FOUED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes. But you can't be dressed like that. Like a parking lot attendant... They are interrupted by the bouncer. THE CAUCASIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Fight! They go running. Three guys are fighting like savages. Al and Foued clean house. Foued gets rid of gawkers. Ali delivers a few random punches, lifts one of the guys off 14

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: his feet and grabs another by the collar. While Foued chases the rowdy men toward the parking lot, Ali helps a girl back to her feet. She's a pretty blond, must be about 27 or 28, who has taken a punch in the face It is Stephanie. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Breathe out of your mouth. In and out. Put your head back. Walk a little. Walk and breathe... He demonstrates how and takes her by the arm, forcing her to walk. She looks groggy. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go home... ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have friends here? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I came alone. I have my car in the lot. I'll be fine. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't drive like that. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. I'm fine, I said. Thanks. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't drive like that. I'll call you a cab. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I get my car afterwards? Seriously, I'll be fine. Trust me! We hear a voice from the parking lot. ANGRY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch! Stephanie looks back. 15     ANGRY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... you, you cunt. Bitch! She ignores him, pretending not to see him. She then notices the blood stains on her T-shirt. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your car?

dialogues.speaker: INT. STEPHANIE'S CAR. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ali drives. His head seems to touch the roof of the littl Fiat and his thighs are too thick for the seat. He glance over at Stephanie. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still bleeding? Keep your head back. Wait... He manipulates the knob to push her seat back. He grimace in pain. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hurt yourself? He shows her his right wrist. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's swelling up. He rests his hand on the wheel. After a beat: ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You often go to the Fever? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you go alone? No answer. 16     ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To dance? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To find a guy? She turns and looks down her nose at him: STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dressed like that just for dancing? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I dressed? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Look. He points to her skirt, riding up her thighs. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so what? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like a hooker. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you call it? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this. Pull over here! ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop this car on the double! 17

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reaction. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's MY car! If I tell you to stop, you stop! Still no reaction, as if she hadn't said a thing. She is about to scream again, but remains silent, although open- mouthed. She finally settles back down on the back of her seat and looks elsewhere. A beat. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed like that, it's no surprise that... STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough now! They ride in silence. 23. EXT. SIMON & STEPHANIE'S BUILDING. NIGHT The Fiat stops in front of a small building in a flowery residential neighborhood. They climb out. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will you get back? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. She takes out her wallet. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, stop! STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a taxi. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Got any ice at your place? He shows her his wrist. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice cubes. 18     STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, I'll go check. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can come up. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Even she is surprised by the brusqueness of her response. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Someone's up there. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here. I'll be right back. She takes a few steps, fumbling for her keys. She hesitates, then looks back. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, come on up. 24. INT. SIMON & STEPHANIE'S APARTMENT. NIGHT They enter the apartment. The light is on. Simon comes ou of the bedroom in his boxer shorts and a T-shirt. He's thirty, blond, and there is something commanding about hi look that could be thought to resemble Stephanie's. He discovers Ali and the blood stains on Stephanie's T- SHIRT: SIMON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? What's going on? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. A fight... SIMON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? 19     STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm fine. SIMON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to Ali) Who's he? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bouncer from the Fever. He drove me home. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (introducing himself)... Ali. SIMON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fever? What the hell were you doing there? Ali opens the refrigerator. SIMON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking for? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice cubes. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurt his hand... Simon pulls Stephanie into the bedroom. Ice cubes in a Plexiglas salad bowl. Ali's hand in the bowl. He looks around. There are photos on the wall: Stephanie surfing on the ba of a killer whale, Stephanie posing with a group of young people in diving suits in front of the Marineland logo, Stephanie rising out of the water on Niska's rostrum, etc From the nearby bedroom, he hears snatches of Simon's REPROACHES: SIMON (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you decide to go out, call me. That's all! Who were you with there? STEPHANIE (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philippe and Christine. 20     SIMON (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you went out to dinner. STEPHANIE (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We decided to go out for a drink after. SIMON (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get my text messages? Why didn't you answer me? Stephanie comes back into the kitchen. She has changed he T-shirt. She seems tense. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling better? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you in the picture with the orcas? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not orcas. Just one orca. Her name is Niska. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your job? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep... Ali nods vaguely admiringly. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck... I didn't think that... STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That what? A whore could train whales? Well, you see... Simon is at the door. He is wearing a jean. SIMON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Ali) Okay, are you done now? Can you leave us alone? Ali stares him down. 21     ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talking to me? It's as if Ali's calm, peremptory tone suddenly let Simon know who he was dealing with. SIMON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but... ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what? SIMON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, forget it... In one second, Stephanie sees Simon's face undergo a metamorphosis, his nervous authority suddenly disappear. She glances at Ali as if to say âPlease go now.' He gets up and wipes his hands on a dish rag. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm going. So long. (pointing to a piece of paper on the table) I left you my number if ever you need it... 25. INT. SIMON & STEPHANIE'S APARTMENT - BATHROOM - N She dissolves an aspirin in a toothbrush glass. She check her lip in the medicine chest mirror. She notices Simon watching her from the bathroom doorway. SIMON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Are you upset? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not upset. She drinks the aspirin. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw your face before... SIMON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before? 22     STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that guy who dropped me off. I saw your face. I saw how you piped down. SIMON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I piped down? Me? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you piped down... (pause) Don't tell me what I should do, how I should live my life. Don't give me any more orders, Simon. SIMON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me any more orders, that's all. She turns on the faucet and runs her lips under the water CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARINELAND. TRAINERS' OFFICE. DAY
dialogues.text: Two rooms adjoining the locker room. Two desks, and on th walls pictures of the trainers with their orcas, laminate posters of various training methods, files for each anima Stephanie is in her diving suit, sitting in front of Louise, a 23-year-old woman who is reading a document abo her internship. A trainer leaves the locker room, his backpack slung over his shoulder. TRAINER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming? No answer. Tension. He leaves without a word. Louise looks up. She has been crying. Stephanie looks at her, impassive. Louise swallows her tears. LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really... this isn't fair. 23     STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Louise, there are lots of things you can say but not that. The pools are my responsibility and all I care about are the animals. I have to see to their environment and that starts with their trainers. Do you understand? LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to make me believe, that I wasn't up to par? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, listen. LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lacking in maturity? Skills? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not consistent. We've already discussed that. The foundation of the relationship with the orcas is stability. During your internship you've had your ups and downs. It's not your competence that... LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this has nothing to do with my internship. You couldn't care less if I was competent or not! It has to do with that I fucked Michael. Just say so. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please... LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in fact what really bothers you is not that we fucked, but that he told me about you. How you think you're so... How you've become such a bitch. That's why you're firing me. That's what you should write in your report. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, are you done? We can stop here. No need to spoil the rest of your internship. Louise stands up. 24

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The empty stadium above the pool. The trainers walk along the gangplanks busily. In her diving suit, Stephanie leans over the "beach" of pool 3. She taps on the surface of the water. A wave forms, whirling around the pool. The whale washes up on the "beach" beside her. She perfor what looks like a daily ritual. She examines the whale, caresses it. The whale responds with uncanny gurgles.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARINELAND. DAY
dialogues.text: Stock shots of a show at Marineland, or images which we will film to resemble stock shots: wide-angle shots from the stadium. The sound equipment blares "Jump" by Van Halen, orcas sho out of the water, the audience applaudsâ¦ Little kids cl electric-blue dolphin balloons, getting splashed by the orcasâ¦ Images of the show are relayed on giant video screens, orcas shoot by like torpedoes behind the plastic protective wall in front of the main pool, etcâ¦ CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARINELAND POOL. DAY
dialogues.text: All at once, silence. Then surface noise, but muted by th cubic meters of waterâ¦ Underwater shots from pool number 3. Overhead, the surface shines like a mirror. In pool numbe 3, a five-ton black shadow bides its time: it is Niska. Behind the grate in pool number 3, Niska watches her mate diving and surfacing in a spray of bubbles. A mechanical creak, then the grate slowly begins to lift. It's about to be her turn. 25

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niska swims into the big pool, slowly at first, but then picks up speed. She surfaces, disappears for a long beat, then again reappears, churning up a whirlpool of bubbles. On the other side of the mirror, the music blares and the crowd cheers. What looks like a small black and white arrow dives into the pool. We recognize Stephanie. She caresses Niska's rostrum, then kisses it, hanging onto her fins, waltzing with her up to the surface. Her hands look ridiculously tiny on the huge black fins. We see her face mirrored in one of the orca's huge black, gentle eyes. A liquid world of greens and blues whirls around them. Now, with her legs slightly arched on the rostrum, Stephanie has Niska swim around the pool, accelerating th water pressure and speed. The plastic wall rushes by, a rush of adrenalineâ¦ clouds of sediment are lifted as if a gust of wind. A young male, Tom, joins Niska in pool number 1. Niska immediately rushes him, as if riled by the intrusion, and flattens him against the plastic wall. In the shifting reflections at the water's surface, we ca make out Stephanie and two other trainers' faces on the âbeach'. Their palms beat on the water, summoning the o for their next number. Tom gathers some momentum, then shoots around Niska to ju into first place. He disappears a moment, then is back in the water after a dozen meters of aquaplaning. Niska then gets into place and takes a running start, but just as she is about to shoot out of the water, Tom appea out of nowhere and forces the huge female to leap over hi We sense chaos up above. Then we see Niska crash back int the water, with, one after the other, a piece of the huge video screen that towered over the stage, bits of scenery and all kinds of random objects, as if Niska had carried away half the platform in her wakeâ¦ It all seems to fal in slow motion, like flecks of snow in a snow globe. Something sinks toward usâ¦ a body, floating weightless disjointed in a cloud of red. 26

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie is on the rim of the pool. All around her: the audience panics, a loudspeaker orders evacuation, Louise leans over her. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... What happened? LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Niska... They got in each other's way. Then Louise sees blood spurting from the rips in her divi suit. She tries to find a pressure point. Stephanie sees Louise's face wet with tears: STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, calm down. I'm fine! Her hand searches for something at thigh level, without finding it. She faints.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ROAD TO THE BEACH. DAY
dialogues.text: Ali is wearing his MP3 headset. He runs down the road to the beach, sweat dripping into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ANNA'S HOUSE. DAY
dialogues.text: Sam's toys are lying scattered in the garden, his half- eaten snack is on the table. Ali takes off his headset. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam! No answer. There is some noise over at the kennel. He goe and finds Sam in the kennel, talking to the puppies. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? 27

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam jumps and scuttles to the back of the kennel, but Ali reaches in and grabs him by the arm. Sam is covered in mu straw and dog shit. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gross! You stink! Who's taking care of you? Ali drags him over to the garage to hose him down. The water is freezing cold. Sam hops from one foot to the oth and screams. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Dad! It's cold. Stop! Sam shrieks. An 18 year old tomboy wearing a skimpy tee- shirt comes out of a neighboring house: Joelle, the neighbors' daughter. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you supposed to be taking care of him? What the fuck are you up to? JOELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was next doing the laundry. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look at him! JOELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll put him in the shower. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sam, crying) Don't go in there. It's disgusting. You hear? Joelle takes Sam and disappears inside. Ali is drawn to the living room, when through the half-op door he notices the flat screen turned onto a news channe Onscreen and behind the anchorwoman, he recognizes an ins photo of Stephanie, the same he saw at her place, riding the back of a killer whale. ïïïïïïïïïï Il manque une phrase 28     JOELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was an accident at Marineland. Ali answers without taking his eyes off the screen. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know her. Sam pulls off his towel. He watches his father who is riveted to the screen, glued to the looping footage of th accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. The silence of an on-duty nurses' lounge: a table, a microwave on a mini-fridge, and Louise, standing by the window sipping coffee. She is wearing a fleece jacket, her hair messily pulled back. She hasn't had any sleep. She hears a scream. She rushes into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOSPITAL ROOM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Chaos. Louise rushes into the room. She finds Stephanie crawling on the floor, dragging her IVs. She hesitates, overwhelmed, then calls for help. LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Help! Please! On the linoleum, two stumps stick out of Stephanie's nightshirt: two thick bandages surround her thighs that look like two wrapped hams. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My legs! What did you do with my legs? Two nurses arrive. Stephanie is back in bed, the IVs in her arms. Louise roc her gently. Stephanie's eyes struggle against sleep. She wants to scream again, but doesn't have the strength. She 29

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: falls asleep in Louise's arms. She feels eight years old. Black.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOSPITAL ROOM. DAY/NIGHT
dialogues.text: A series of scenes, day and night, fade into one another, always from the same POV. In the foreground, looking our way, is Stephanie's face and, behind, the visitors who succeed one another. Stephanie's eyes are shut. She opens them: - The other trainers from Marineland, holding bouquets. They are silent and look devastated. They occasionally speak to each other in whispers. Stephanie closes her eyes. Black. Stephanie opens her eyes: - Louise is seated nearby LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stopped by your place. I saw the cleaning woman. She didn't want me to pay her. She was... in shock. She's scared to come here. She sends her regards. She closes her eyes. Black. She opens them. - A blonde, pretty woman in her fifties is sitting behind Stephanie, her face is close to hers. It is her mother. She speaks with a slight accent. MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spoke to your brothers. They wanted to talk to you but I didn't think it was the right time. We'll all come with Hugo during the next school break... I was afraid I might lose you. I don't know what I'd have 30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: done... It may seem selfish. In any case, you've always done whatever you wanted. But this time I was so scared that I don't think I'll ever be scared again. Her eyes close. Black. Her eyes reopen. The surgeon and his assistants. The orthopedist and his assistants. Her eyes close. Black. Her eyes open. - Simon is there, looking stiff and ill at ease. He tries not to make any noise as he puts a bunch of keys on the night stand. He leans over and kisses her hair. Her eyes close. Black. It's her mother again, but this time accompanied by a tal uncomfortable looking blond teenage boy. She leans over t kiss her. MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in German) Hugo wanted to say goodbye to you. We're leaving tomorrow but we'll pray for you, honey. Her eyes remain open. Black.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARINELAND. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The bluish light at the bottom the main pool at Marinelan A diver is raking its bottom, wiping away sludge composed of micro algae, paint chips and fish bones. He examines t replacement mud and then, inside the drain, the mud being replaced. He digs his hand into the sediment and feels something there. He surfaces and deposits his find on the rim of the pool: It is one of Stephanie's diving flippers with her foot cut off at the ankle. 31     CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie wakes up with a start in her handicapped bathtu She tries to grab the bars but can't find them. She rolls over on herself like a floating log. She panics. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are several rows of parallel bars, with amputees hanging on to them as they relearn to walk with their prosthetics. Most of them are old. Nurses help them along From her wheelchair, Stephanie watches, looking glum and if at a great distance. Her hair is greasy and her face swollen by her medication and induced sleep. She looks through the big window that opens onto the exterior. Outside, amputees smoke and chat. She notices o group, livelier than the rest. At its center, a guy is smoking a cigarette he holds in a pincer in the place of his hand. His name is Gilles.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GILLES' CAR. EVENING
dialogues.text: Four of them are smoking a joint in Gilles' Megane. Outside, evening is falling over the convalescent center' parking lot. Stephanie is sitting up front. She passes the joint to Gilles, who takes it in his chrome pincer. She notices th scar that deforms his face and one side of his mouth. There is a couple in the backseat, making out: Raphael (h arms are missing and his sleeves are pinned up at his shoulders) and Julia. GILLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stephanie) Want me to tell you something? 32     STEPHANIE Â¦ GILLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't finished mourning, that's all! STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Mourning who? GILLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your legs. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mourning my legs? GILLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He sounds as serious as a civics teacher. She looks at hi incredulous. Raphael sticks his head up front. RAPHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass me the joint... Gilles' pincer and joint go for Raphael's lips. He takes long hit. GILLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were a part of you. When a man dies, he gets buried. There's a ceremony, a prayer... Now a piece of you ended up in a hospital trashcan without a prayer, without any time for meditation. A beat. She is dumbstruck. She cannot believe what she's hearing. In the backseat, Raphael exhales some smoke into Julia's open mouth. GILLES (cont'd) You have to think about it symbolically... STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's really symbolic... 33     GILLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where my arm is. We buried it under a nice oak tree behind my house in the scrubland. My wife and kids came and we sang... Stephanie has a fit of the giggles. GILLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bit vexed) You think I'm kidding? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's the grass. I'll stop... She laughs so hard she cries. RAPHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, it's a laugh riot up there. (to Gilles) Can you take us home? She looks back and, between the seats, notices the girl toying with Raphael's fly. GILLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm too beat. I'll take a nap, then go. (to Stephanie) How are you getting home?

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. HYPERBRICO. NIGHT
dialogues.text: A HyperBrico DIY store in an industrial zone in Cannes. I windows shine in the night like an aquarium.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HYPERBRICO. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ali and Kadhi, a huge guard accompanied by a dog, make their rounds. They open doors with a magnetic key, each time recording their passage on electronic terminals. A bit before midnight, someone knocks at the main entranc Ali goes to look. It's a guy in a leather jacket and baseball cap, with a backpack and a shoulder bag. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? 34     MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To come in. The guy takes out a card and presses it against the glass door: it's the business card of ALTA SECU, the security agency. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Kadhi, come here! Kadhi comes over and looks at the guy. KADHI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... Are you Martial? MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. KADHI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your keys. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's he? KADHI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. The boss told me he was coming. He works for the company. Ali hands him the bunch of keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali goes down an aisle looking for something and finally finds what he was looking for: a folding ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martial has spread out his material in a stock room at th back of the store at the end of a corridor formed by palettes: precision tools, drills, electronic mini-camera still in their wrapping, cases equipped with antennae, packs of batteries... A small radio is playing a night program on Radio Monte Carlo. Equipped with a small headlamp, Martial carefully cuts a hole in a cardboard box with his Leatherman scissors. He conceals a tiny camera inside. 35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali arrives with the ladder over his shoulder. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will this do? MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. Put it down there. Martial climbs the ladder to place the box high on a shel MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine you're the manager of a big store like this and the union reps have been busting your balls. What do you do? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire them. MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's how it works? What do you do before you fire them? He checks to make sure the lens is aligned with the hole, then checks the screen and reception on a small pocket monitor. MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, beforehand you try to see how long they spend in the restroom, if they take extra-long coffee breaks, smoke on the premises, steal from the stockroom, rip customers off with the sales receipts... When you know all that, you put the pressure on them and you fire the ones who don't leave. Can you give me a stroll down the aisle? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stroll? MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk down the aisle. No, further down, like you came out of that door there. Good, perfect... Ali twice passes within the camera's field of vision. Martial climbs down his ladder. 36     MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then I'll be getting back. MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on! Martial pulls a 10 Euro bill from a jacket pocket. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it. Angle on the bill in Ali's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali is in the security room reading a kickboxing magazine A small radio is playing a late evening program. Outside in the parking lot, Kadhi smokes while walking his dog. T dog takes its time. Ali watches Kadhi pull on the leash. Ali's cell phone rings. The screen reads âunknown'. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? STEPHANIE (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Stephanie. Remember me? We met at the Fever. Ali is taken by surprise. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... How are you doing? She sniggers. Her speech sounds slow and thick. STEPHANIE (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what happened to me? 37     ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I saw the papersâ¦ the news on TVâ¦ How are you? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sniggering) How do you think I am? A beat. Ali is at a loss to answer. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... normal. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still a bouncer? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not really. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to get together? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but nights are tough. I'm a security guard now. Three nights a week. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... crazy busy too. Every day and every night. I don't know how to manage... A beat. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Speciale 50 putt-putts in the early morning light. Al drives through a neighborhood of chain stores, Conforama, 38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Courtepaille, Leroy-Merlin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gated community made up of four story buildings, lawns, bougainvillea and lavender. It looks pretty as a picture and squeaky clean.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STEPHANIE'S APARTMENT. DAY
dialogues.text: The door opens automatically. He is surprised. He hears a tired voice from inside. STEPHANIE (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in. She is waiting in her wheelchair, holding the remote control. She activates it and the door closes behind Ali. Her hair is mid-length, her face has thickened and there are bags under her eyes. She is wearing a baggy Nike T- shirt with burn marks here and there and a pajama bottom whose legs hang limp. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been waiting long? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I just got here. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that you who rang before? She looks exhausted but feverish. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in. Sit down. He sits down on a small couch. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want something to drink? A coffee? 39     ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only have instant. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine. It takes two tries to activate the wheels on her wheelchair. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need any help? She answers with a growl, as much for him as for her wheelchair, then goes into the kitchen. He sees her pajam legs flap like rags, he hears the noise of the tap. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been living here long? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Three or four months. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around)... It's nice. She comes back. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alone? You got no one to help you? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me what? Walk? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, for the cleaning and everything... STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah there are people. They come and go. Hold on. She manages to navigate from the living room into her bedroom. He stays in the living room. He hears a kettle whistle in the kitchen. He goes into the kitchen and pour water into the glass/mug. He finds her hunched over in he 40

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wheelchair. She is nodding off, high on her medication. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, are you okay? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. He opens the window. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it stink here? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, a little. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. He opens the curtains and looks outside. It is getting ho out. The automatic sprinklers have gone on. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go out. (No answer) Hey, you hear me? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go out. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get dressed. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are your clothes? He opens the closet. 41

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they come out of the building's lobby, the sun hits him on the head like a bad hangover. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Ali hands her a pair of sunglasses. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where should we go? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You're the one who wanted to go out... ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we go to the ocean? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. He tries to push the wheelchair, but she stops him: STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it. I want to puke. He notices that his moped is attached in the middle of a sprinkler area. He goes to free it and gets splashed... Heavy chain, padlock... he comes back with soiled hands. When he comes back, she's gone. He sees the wheelchair moving toward the seafront avenue. He goes to join her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are sitting at a table on a terrace facing the beach They remain silent. She looks at his huge fists, black wi axle grease. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go in. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: â¦ ? 42     ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like swimming! STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't feel like swimming? She looks daggers at him. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a bathing suit? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you realize what you're saying? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck cares? There's no one here! STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. He wavers a moment, then finally crosses the seafront avenue.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PRIVATE BEACH. DAY
dialogues.text: Stephanie is at the top of the steps in her wheelchair. Ali is talking with the beach boy when he notices her. Ali and the beach boy carry her to the deck chair area. Ali rents the whole shebang: parasol, beach towel, deck chair and a small tube of sunscreen 50. Sheltered under a parasol, she pancakes her face with cre and watches him dive in, wearing his boxers, and noisily and clumsily crawl some laps. His body is pink and white. Huge and buff. Then she looks out to sea, the listless waves washing in and out. The fresh feel of it all makes 43

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: her want to drink it all in. He comes back, enthusiastic and dripping wet. She looks around. The beach is deserted, other than for a far off, elderly couple broiling in the sun. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually I think I will go in. He looks at her. She covers herself with a towel and wiggles out of her pants, revealing what remains of her legs. Her stumps are white, with terrible scars at their extremities. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to carry me. Help me... ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (makes a gesture)... How, like this? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He lifts her up and carries her to the water. He takes he far enough in until she begins to float. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let me go! Not right away... Do it gently. She feels unsure of herself. He lets go of her gradually. She starts to sink, then crawls forward, with power and grace. She stops but has to paddle like a dog to tread water. He joins her. She grabs onto him. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stop. If I do, I sink. Wait... She gesticulates... 44     STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bothering me! She takes off her T-shirt and hands it to him. Her breast press against Ali's chest. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you can let go. She lets herself go and crawls like a pro. He stays put, holding her t-shirt. Twenty-five meters later, her head emerges. He hears a burst of laughter. Half asleep in a deck chair, he looks up from time to tim to see how she's doing. She calls out to him. She is sitting in the water. She motions for him to come and get her. He helps her out and takes her into his arms. She hangs o to him, still out of breath. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You swim like a real pro!... She shuts her eyes. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that's good! The beach is crowded now. Ali carries her back to the dec chairs. Some bathers watch them go by, others look away. They are stretched out in their chairs. She has wrapped h lower body in a beach towel. They sunbathe. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. 45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rolls onto her back. He sees her breasts pointed heavenward.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GYM. DAY
dialogues.text: A decrepit, simple, functional, but reasonably clean workout room. Guys of every color work the punching bags, lift weights, do chin-ups... From the gym next door, we hear the booming music of an aerobics class. In a small ring at floor level, Ali and Foued, loaded dow with protective gear, pound each other. Each of their blo lands right on target. They repeat the same series of mov several times at varying speeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali and Foued are dripping wet. They have towels around their necks. They fill their small plastic bottles at a faucet in the workout room. Through a large window in the corridor, Ali watches the aerobic class going on in the gym: legs and feet moving i rhythm, red faces, sweaty underarms, butts, boobs and the braid of the instructor, who uses it to beat the measure, as she swings it from one shoulder to the other. FOUED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get back. I need to train. Ali nods, without actually looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, Ali has unwrapped the sandwich his sister had prepared for him. A bit farther off, the aerobics instructor is smoking in the sun. She has a short, buff body. She smokes her cigarette like someone who counts th out sparingly. They remain like that a while, he chewing ands she smokin CUT TO 46

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cell phone vibrates. Through a narrow transom, a ray of sun slices through the dark equipment room. They haven't bothered undressing. Ali and the aerobics instructor are making love on a pile of workout mats. Ali's cell phone continues to vibrate, goes silent, vibrates again. He answers. We hear a crackling voice. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still at the gym. I'm leaving... I said I'm leaving! He hangs up. They continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is playing alone, perched up on monkey bars in the schoolyard. Through a wide window, he sees his father racing down a corridor that runs alongside the schoolyard. The principa is waiting for him at the door. Ali spurts out some quick apologies. Sam slowly slides off the structure. We hear the noise of his hands skidding on metal.

dialogues.speaker: EXT ANTIBES EVENING
dialogues.text: The moped wheezes and sputters. Ali and Sam are heading back home along the beach. Ali is so big, the moped looks like a kid's bike. Behind him on the luggage rack, he can feel Sam leaning into him. Sam's hand rummages in his coat pocket for a box of Choco-BN cookies. Ali takes one too. To their left, a train noisily speeds by.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STEPHANIE'S APARTMENT. DAY
dialogues.text: Louise has a set of keys. She enters Stephanie's apartmen with the mail. 47     LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steph! Made up and well-groomed, she looks older than she actual is. Stephanie answers from the bathroom. STEPHANIE (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in here! Louise puts the mail on the living room table and enters the bedroom. Stephanie wheels herself out of the bathroom her hair wet and her body wrapped in a towel. LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, you're not ready! The appointment is in a half hour! STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine! LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? You're a freaking pain! I have to get back to work. Come on, let me help you. She grabs the arms of the wheelchair and pushes Stephanie toward the closet. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of me! Stop, I can manage alone. LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Okay, so manage then! She lets go of the wheelchair and leaves the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise briskly pushes Stephanie's wheelchair across the residence garden. The warning lights on her 205 are blinking in front of the gate. Stephanie hangs onto Louise's neck. Louise lifts her out her wheelchair as best she can and into the passenger sea 48

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise bends down to buckle Stephanie's seat belt. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) I can do the seat belt! In front of the open trunk, Louise struggles to fold the wheelchair. LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you call them to tell them we're going to be late?

dialogues.speaker: INT. PROSTHESIST'S OFFICE. DAY
dialogues.text: In CU: the brochures of prosthetic manufacturersâ¦ we se pictures of the various models go by. Stephanie is in the doctor's office with Doctor Vitias. H is in his fifties and is wearing a white jacket. VITIAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll order two pairs of prosthetic devices, one for everyday life and one for the sport you do. Stephanie pages through the various brochures. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have something simpler, classier? VITIAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean by classier? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... like a wooden leg with a piece of rubber at the end? VITIAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) No, sorry. We don't make those models anymore. Louise shuts her eyes, visibly exasperated. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or just a plank. A plank with wheels and straps. And irons to move forward with. 49     LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) Can you cut it out? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? If I want... LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had enough of your schtick, you hear me? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Stephanie shuts up. Vitias still looks patient as Job.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PROSTHESIST'S OFFICE. DAY
dialogues.text: Sitting on an examination table, Stephanie waits for the resin bands wrapped around her stumps to dry. Louise is sitting on a stool across from Stephanie. Their eyes meet. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go if you wantâ¦ I'll take a taxi. LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told them I was with you. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that works? If you tell them you're with me, do they let you do what you want? LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. If ever you want a day off, just tell me. I'll write you a note. Louise looks at her. She's not going to let her get on he nerves. There is a knock at the door. A nurse enters. She checks the resin bands, looks at her watch. 50     NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 more minutes, just to make sure. Then Doctor Vitias will come for you. She smiles and closes the door. The two young women are again left alone. Stephanie stretches out her hand. Louise takes it. And they remain like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In close up on the screen of a small DVD player: amateur images of two bare-chested guys fighting in the garden of suburban house. It looks like a wild boxing match, free- for-all vale tudo in which anything goes. In the Bricorama security room, Ali, Kadhi and Martial, excited, are bent over the screen. A few blows to the face have one of the combatants KO on the lawn. KADHI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the next one! Watch how he whacks him. A change of scene on the small screen: a courtyard betwee two tower blocks, with new combatants, but with the same amateur images and the same violence. KADHI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to the screen)... I know him. I fought him twice in Nationals. He's not bad. He was at the boxing club in Marseille. Martial watches Ali, fascinated by the images, as if he were sizing him up.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PROJECTS. DAY
dialogues.text: An apartment in a Golfe Juan housing project. After-dinne time. Kids are playing, women doing the dishes. On the living room couch, under a tapestry of a lion hunt in Technicolor, Martial blows on his glass of tea. His 51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cousin is sitting across from him. Ali is on a stool at t end of the table. MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he's done Thai boxing. He can fight. He's enormous. He's not afraid of taking punches, and he's white. COUSIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. The cousin turns to Ali. He takes his time sizing him up. COUSIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that true? You like to fight? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. COUSIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so I organize the fights. I pick the fighters. I see if the money's there. I ref. I collect the dough... I take a third of the bets. The rest goes to the winner... MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A third of how much? COUSIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't fight for less than 800. Ali does the division in his head. MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? Ali hesitates. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Martial) There's something I don't get: how much do you take? MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You tell me. How much do you need? I'll take 20% of what you win. How's that? 52     ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how much does your cousin give you? MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I introduced you to him, didn't I? How's that? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. The cousin stands up. They all shake on it.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LIVING ROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: Ali is in a corner of the living room, sitting in front o Anna's old PC and watching some fight videos he's found. Anna rushes into the room. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep Sam with you for 5 minutes! She hurries to find some papers in the drawer of a commod Ali hasn't budged. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Hear me? I don't want your son in the garden. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I heard. He gets up and goes to get Sam who is playing behind the house. Anna finds her papers and leaves in another direction. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam! Come here! I want to show you some stuff! He lifts Sam up with one arm and goes back to the compute ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look how they fight... He clicks on an image and the fight continues... the audience's noise as well. Sam watches, intrigued. Ali 53

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: commentates, pointing to guys onscreen. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him, in red. See how strong he is? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he the good guy? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's the bad guy. Look how he tries to grab his legs. Wait. His phone vibrates. He takes it from his pocket. It's Martial. He answers. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Yeah... SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is the red one the bad guy? Daddy? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Look and tell me who wins. He turns down the sound, settles Sam on the stool and get up to go speak. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) So? What did he say? Which others? How many? Sam watches the fight in silence. Dogs bark in the garden Sam feels something coming. He looks out the window, then goes running. Ali hasn't noticed a thing and continues his phone conversation. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this bullshit? What do you mean, a tournament?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martial is leaning on the bar of a noisy Arab cafe/bettin office, talking into his phone. 54     MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last one standing gets the money. I know, but he says it's better that way. Do you think you're in a position to negotiate a percentage? Where did you get that idea from? He gave me a website if you want to see the others. He takes out a small spiral notebook.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LIVING ROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: From the living room, Ali hears Sam screaming in the garden. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to give the website to his mother. All I see is me doing more fights and him making more dough. Ali goes to the window. Outside, near the kennel, Sam has lunged at a guy in a jumpsuit who is helping Anna get the puppies into a metal cage. Sam is screaming. Anna tries to take him into her arms. Sam clutches the bars of the cage. The puppies bark Anna finally manages to rip Sam free and drag him back in the house. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) He's changing the rules and so am I... I couldn't care less. Anna storms into the living room. Sam is shrieking, havin a tantrum. He kicks and bites. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on the phone! ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? I asked you to watch him for 5 minutes! ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) I'll call you back. Ali hangs up. 55

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, the kennel keeper rolls the cage across the garden. Anna hugs Sam in her arms. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sam) He's taking them to the country. They'll be so happy there. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone. They're my babies! Sam refuses to calm down. Anna looks at her brother. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Are you his father or not? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such a pain in the ass. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk to me like that! Ali rips the child from his sister's grip. Sam struggles. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it now! I said stop! Calm the fuck down! SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of me! Let go! Sam kicks out. Ali shakes him. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it out, dammit! You're such a pain! He flings the child away. Sam's head hits the coffee tabl Silence. Anna rushes over and picks up Sam, who has stopped crying He's been knocked out. Anna is frightened. She examines h scalp, she strokes his head. She trembles. A cut on his head begins to bleed. She kisses the wound. Ali comes ove upset. 56     ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch him! Don't touch him I said! You know what? You're... you're a bad person. Huddled against Anna's breasts, Sam opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BEACH. DAY
dialogues.text: The day is over. The beach boy has already packed away mo of his paraphernalia. In the water, Ali and Stephanie are out with some of the last swimmers. Faithful to what by now seems to have become a habit, he carries her piggyback to their lounge chairs. They come o of the water in the middle of a discussion. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of boxing? Thai? Do you use your feet? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just fists I think. We bash each other's faces and whoever's still standing at the end wins. Hey, you're strangling me! He puts her down on her chair. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it the first time you're doing this? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're not scared? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do they pay you for this? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. About 500, 1000 maybe. 57     STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing that for 500 euros? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, yeah. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to get whacked on the face and risk your health for 500 euros? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Risk my health? What are you talking about? Why are you getting so worked up? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you the 500! Cancel it and I'll give it to you tomorrow. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can give it to me if you have too much money, but I said I was doing it and I am. That's all. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's not for money, why then? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say it's not for the money! STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing it? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, stop driving me crazy! I'm doing it to fight. For fun. Why did you clown around on your fish? For the fun of it, right? She grins. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah and look how I ended up. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spare me. You turn on the waterworks when you feel like it. 58

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dries her eyes. He begins to pack things up. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your fight, if you do it... ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I can come along?

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. MARTIAL'S MERCEDES. DAY
dialogues.text: A narrow road. Down below, a town. The Mercedes Vito with the tinted windows lifts a cloud of dust. Stephanie is in the back seat and has to hold on to the overhead strap to avoid hurting herself. At the end of the road is a gate guarded by two huge homies. They signal Martial to over. He rolls down his window and the two homies peer inside. They see Ali and Stephanie in the back. HOMEBOY 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's she? MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His girlfriend. Surprised, Stephanie looks at Ali, watching for his reaction. He looks elsewhere. The gate opens. Martial drives in.

dialogues.speaker: EXT / INT. MARTIAL'S MERCEDES. DAY
dialogues.text: Ali and Stephanie are alone in the car. Through the tinte windows, they can see a concrete yard with boats dry-dock around it and buildings with satellite dishes studding every balcony. Some men are over in one corner, discussing: Martial, his cousin and some other mean looki guys. In the shade, a bit to one side and surrounded by his fan is a bare-chested, muscle-bound North African. He warms u 59

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wagging his head from left to right. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Motherfucker's acting like he's on Canal Plus. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are the other guys? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Guys with money. Dealers. A beat. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Martial comes back with a wad of banknotes and slides int the passenger seat. MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Let's go. Fall against the big one in black shorts. I told you. They're big guys. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. And the bets? How much is there? MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little over 2000 for the time being. But it'll go up during the final match. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do? MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No girls. Stay in the car. (To Ali) You ready? Ali nods. 60

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PROJECTS COURTYARD. DAY
dialogues.text: The blazing sun is melting the asphalt. A coin bounces between pairs of basketball shoes. The cousin picks it up. He points to Ali and the guy in t black shorts. COUSIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and you. Ali pulls off his T-shirt, staring down his adversary. Martial takes the T shirt and leans over to Ali. MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you get into trouble, don't insist, just fall. Ali doesn't flinch. The cousin, the bettors and the other fighters move away.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARTIAL'S MERCEDES. DAY
dialogues.text: Stephanie watches the faces leaning over the balconies overhead. She hears the spectators' hostility and cheers. A circle has formed around the fighters. She sees the shadow, and only the shadow, of his opponent fist barely miss Ali's face. Then things speed up. Ali uses his feet, knees and fists. When his opponent begins to totter to one side, Ali hangs onto him like a pit bull. When he falls, Ali pounds on hi face with his fists and elbows. The âref' has to enlist Cousin's help to pull Ali away. Ali returns to his place in the car. Stephanie looks at him: he can't sit still. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go. Another combat begins, while Ali jogs around the hangar. Stephanie watches other combats, whether featuring Ali or not. 61

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees feet dancing on the concrete. She sees the banknotes in people's hands. She sees heads leaning over balconies. She sees an opponent's fist hit Ali behind the ear. She sees another of Ali's opponents get back to his feet, and Ali's fist split open his nose like a ripe fig. She sees another opponent's head bounce off the concrete. She sees a tooth roll across the concrete, like dice in a crap game. She sees Ali perform three steps of a moonwalk and kiss h own biceps.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ROAD. DAY
dialogues.text: A cloud of dust, a narrow, bumpy road. Martial's car is headed for the town below.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARTIAL'S MERCEDES. DAY
