dialogues.text: CU on a long cut behind Ali's ear. Stephanie's fingers us a Kleenex instead of cotton. Bare-chested with a towel around his neck, Ali leans forward to make his wound more easily accessible. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing, just a cut. (to Martial) Got anything to disinfect it with? MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (driving) No. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ali) Keep this on it. It's the only one I have. Ali looks up at her. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You liked it. 62     STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. He again lowers his head. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put this on it. It's the only one I have. Ali straightens up, covers himself with the towel and remains like that: invisible, out of breath, clearing his throat and spitting out the window... Stephanie observes the welts on his body. A big service station appears a bit farther down the road Ali sits back up. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull over here. I'll go rinse off my face. (puts out his hand) Give me 50. Martial uses his turn signal.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARTIAL'S MERCEDES. DAY
dialogues.text: Behind the wheel of his stopped car, Martial counts the bills spread out on his lap. MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you known him for long? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not very. Alone in the back seat, Stephanie looks out at the servic station. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to know? If I knew him before the accident? Martial looks back. 63     MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find it weird that we're together? You wonder what he's doing with me? MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, since you know him, I just wanted to know if you've seen him like that before? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Martial finishes counting the bills. MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He freaks me out. He takes his share and hands Stephanie the envelope. MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1200 for him. She looks at the envelope without taking it. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you giving me that? MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for Ali. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. So why give it to me? He looks at her, suddenly surprised. MARTIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you make it complicated. Either you take it or you don't. And either I talk or I keep my mouth shut. He tosses the envelope at her. She looks away. Ali finall gets back into the car with a big box. It's a toy: a gree John Deere tractor with all the accessories. 64     ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For my kid. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a kid? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The afternoon sun has the entire coast sparkling. Ali is his moped, with the box between his knees, driving up the coastal road. He looks splendid, wearing new clothes. He finally sees what he was looking for: a group on the beach, Anna, Richard and their neighbors, having a picnic CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BEACH. DAY

dialogues.text: That... and you!

dialogues.text: Stephanie walks down a corridor. She stops in front of a door and knocks. GÃ¼nther opens. He looks surprised. He i barefoot, in a pair of trousers and an unbuttoned shirt. He looks at her inquisitively, and when she still doesn't SAY ANYTHING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GÃNTHER (in German) Are you okay? Do you need anything? She hesitates. STEPHANIE (in German) I... I came to see if I got it wrong, or not. He knits his brow. GÃNTHER (in German) Got what wrong? STEPHANIE (in German) You don't understand? 107

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GÃNTHER (in German) Excuse me? STEPHANIE (in German) I got the impression, the way you were looking at me before... Try to understand because this is getting hard for me... GÃNTHER (in German) No, you didn't get it wrong. He smiles and opens the door. GÃNTHER (in German) I have someone in my life, you know. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I. He draws her inside. The door closes.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SUPERMARKET. DAY
dialogues.text: Anna is about to open her cash register, when a West Indi in a security uniform whispers into her ear, apparently asking her to follow him. Another cashier is already waiting to take her place. Anna joins three other employees waiting in a corridor. They exchange a few words under their breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna comes out of an office, looking distraught. She has lean against the wall to hold herself up. A colleague com to help. COLLEAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got fired. COLLEAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. There's something we want to show you. 108

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the locker room, we recognize the girl who had photographed Ali while he was trying to reclaim Martial's camera equipment. The girl says something to Anna. When i seems that Anna can not believe her ears, the girl takes out her cell phone and confronts her with the evidence. Anna needs to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HOUSE. DAY
dialogues.text: Out of breath, Ali pushes open the gate and climbs the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KITCHEN. DAY
dialogues.text: In the kitchen, Anna and Richard are sitting at the table in front of a meal they haven't had the appetite to start ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? No answer. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem it. He goes to open the fridge. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close it! Don't eat here. Ali stares at her, stunned. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't eat here. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on? ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was fired this morning. I'm unemployed. 109     ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... But what's the problem if I eat here? Anna stands up. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had cameras in the storeroom... They filmed us when we took the expired food. They fired us. Ali's head spins. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had your sister fired. How does it feel? How much did you get for that? You get paid per person or a flat rate? Nothing to say? I take you in, I take care of your son and you have nothing to say? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't know... ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't know? You couldn't know what? That you were screwing us out of jobs? That you were hurting people? Ali tries to find something to say, but his sister's hand delivers a resounding slap. He takes it like a man. A moment passes. Ali is red from the slap, red with shameâ¦ until he suddenly straightens and knocks over the table. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down. Calm down, I said! Ali looks back. He sees Richard's grim face at the other end of a hunting rifle. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your stuff and get out of here. We don't want to see you around here anymore. 110

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden noise draws their attention: Sam is watching fro the top of the stairs. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to your room. Go upstairs immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An SMS arrives from Stephanie: âAlmost there. I miss yo Ali is lying on his mattress. He puts down the phone. He hears Anna and Richard's voices upstairs. He sits up and begins to stuff things into a bag. A new message arrives: âI'm home. Oper?â Ali hesitate then turns off his phone and clicks his bag closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night has fallen. Sam's nose is stuck to his bedroom window. He sees his aunt sitting at the plastic table in the garden downstairs with her face in her hands. A door slams. Sam rushes to the bathroom window. He sees his father stomp down the street, never once looking back Sam remains glued to the window pane. Ali's silhouette moves through the halo of a streetlight before again disappearing into the dark. Sam watches him for as far as he can. Fade to black.

dialogues.speaker: INT/ EXT. BASEMENT. DAY
dialogues.text: In the half-light of the basement, a rectangle of light h formed where the door opens onto the street. Stephanie looks over Ali's mess: his magazines, body building equipment, dirty T-shirts, track suits hanging over a trestle... Anna is standing against the light at the door and, a bit farther off, Sam is sitting on the stairs watching them. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his message he said he was in Strasbourg. No news since. I don't know what he's doing 111

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: there, or even if he's still there. Has he called you? She shakes her head "no". ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you try the gym? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. They don't know. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had an address or a number, I'd give it to you... Even if I think it's dumb. Do you believe me? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After what he did to me... Sam sees Stephanie join Anna near the door. She's about t leave. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He abandoned his kid. He doesn't give a fuck about anything. All he ever cared about was himself. He's totally selfish. Sam watches the two women swallowed up by the light. STEPHANIE (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know him. ANNA (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? What did you expect with him? STEPHANIE (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Not this. Fade to black. Black. 112

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ALSATIAN COUNTRYSIDE. MORNING
dialogues.text: A frosty landscape with trees that look like they've been engraved in ink... A group of twelve joggers in blue trac suits run across a landscape of gray sky and snow. Some shadowbox while running. Ali is wearing a wool cap pulled down around his ears. He runs alongside Foued.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOLIDAY VILLAGE. GYM. DAY
dialogues.text: A ring has been set up in the middle of the gym. A few gu have gathered round to watch Ali rhythmically pound on hi trainer's bear-like paws. Leonardini sets the pace. LEONARDINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1,2... 1,2,3,4... Faster! 1,2,3. Yes. Faster! Move! You're stepping back! Ali pounds harder and harder. He times his respiration to match the movement of his fists.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOLIDAY VILLAGE REC ROOM. EVENING
dialogues.text: Young athletes, some tall, some short, some heavyset, som not, are sitting on refectory chairs to watch TV. Ali doe too. His hair is cut short and his face is closely shaven He looks younger. He could be a student.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A truck rushes headlong through the countryside. First it is day, then night.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOLIDAY VILLAGE. DAY
dialogues.text: Through the window, Ali sees a twelve-ton Scania pull to stop at the entrance to the parking lot and beep its horn Ali runs out to meet it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard lowers his window. 113     RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't come in any further or I won't be able to get back out! Ali checks out the huge semi. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you changed trucks! RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bosses, in fact. I'm back to being exploited. Ali doesn't insist. Richard opens his door to let out Sam who is already trampling him, trying to get out. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sam) Got everything? Your bag, your coat, your hat, your mittens? You haven't forgotten anything? Now give me a kiss. Sam gives him a kiss. Richard slips him out and into Ali' arms. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are things there? RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're okay. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister? RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She found a job at a school cafeteria. She seems to enjoy it. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she know about today? RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She says it's good for the kid. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her I can't help out for the time being but that as soon as I have a little money... 114     RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. When's your fight? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next month. On the 9th. Richard smiles admiringly. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep us posted if you win. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I will. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right... Okay, I'm off. I'll deliver my load in Colmar and pick up the kid at around 7, okay? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No later, because I have to be back tomorrow at 11. The two men say good-bye. Sam waves good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ALSATIAN COUNTRYSIDE. DAY
dialogues.text: A path runs through fields and into a clump of fir trees. Ali pulls a plastic sled with Sam on top. Whenever there a slope, he lets Sam glide down it and runs after him. Snow falls from the trees. He looks up and sees a couple squirrels jump from branch to branch. Sam has never seen any before. Ali neither. Sunlight filters through the branches. A group of cross- country skiers trudges by. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to skate too! 115     ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not skating. They're skiing. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're skating. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're skiing, I said! SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skating. A few steps on: ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skiing. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're annoying me. They take a break at a picnic area, where they eat some sandwiches and drink orange soda. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his mouth full) Does Auntie still have dogs? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, now it's chickens. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the garden? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, in the cage. They lay eggs. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Auntie doesn't want me to take the chicks in my room. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right. They're disgusting. (pointing to his sandwich) Finished? You want some 116

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: applesauce? Afternoon. On the way back, they find a frozen pond. Ali carefully advances on the ice. He tests it. Jumps on it. Then he lets himself go and glides across the ice. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go. But not too far! Sam starts slipping and sliding. He falls down. He lies o the sled and lets it glide. Ali pees behind a tree. Sam is far away. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we have to head back! SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5 minutes. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing his fingers) 5 minutes! ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5 minutes. And then suddenly, instead of gliding, the child sinks. H tries to climb out and sinks again. A thin layer of ice i forming over him. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy! Daddy! ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Ali rushes to the pond, but Sam is already iced over. He kneels down and then crawls on his stomach toward the hol Sam has disappeared. Ali shoves aside snow. He looks everywhere, but sees nothing. And then he hears a noise, blows like signals coming from under the ice. Ali crawls 117

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: over and clears away snow as best he can. Under the ice, sees Sam's face, staring wide-eyed. Ali begins to pound both his fists on the ice, like pisto or pestles... As if pounding on his punching bag.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE ICE. DAY
dialogues.text: Underwater, we hear the sound of dull thuds. Sam sees his father's fists pound on the ice. He sees bloodstains. The ice cracks, a bloody fist searches the water for him. Sam closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. POND. EVENING
dialogues.text: Evening is falling. Ali has stretched Sam out on the rim the pond. The child has turned blue. He tries mouth-to- mouth resuscitation, he massages his heart and rubs him down.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. COUNTRY ROAD. EVENING
dialogues.text: Ali's respiration has become a grunt, then a groan. He runs. He has stowed Sam behind the front of his parka and runs as fast as he can. He slips, gets back up and ru again... he again breathes into Sam's mouth... while stil running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaning against the window of the Intensive Care Unit, Al sees Sam's nude, tiny body being worked on by doctors... his skin is blue from the cold... there is a tube in his mouth... his ribs rise and fall to the rhythm of a respirator... his mouth spits out brackish water brutally... A door opens and a nurse appears. Ali straightens up. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take care of you. Come with me. He doesn't understand. Then he notices the blood prints h hands have left on the ICU window. He looks at his scarre fingers, his broken, bloodied hands. 118

dialogues.speaker: INT. SAM'S HOSPITAL ROOM. EVENING
dialogues.text: Sam is lying in a hospital bed. His eyes are closed and coils of tubes attach him to control apparatus. Ali is at his side. His hands are now wrapped in thick bandages. The disinfectant makes him look like he is wearing yellow gloves halfway up his arms. Richard is standing behind him, near the window. Ali takes Sam's fingers, places them in the palm of his bandaged hand and looks at them. Sam's eyes begin to dart wildly under his eyelids... his fingers quiver... his eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are not many people in the corridor at this late hour. Richard is bent over a coffee machine. A cup slowly fills up. Farther off, Ali is KO, leaning against a wall. Richard brings him a coffee. Ali takes it clumsily into h damaged hands. Richard's cell phone rings. He moves away to answer and speaks into it softly. A few moments later, he returns to Ali and hands him the phone. RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. She wants to talk to you. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna? Richard shakes his head. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? STEPHANIE (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. (pause) Do you mind? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. 119     STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. He woke up an hour ago. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he injured? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't think so. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how are you? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fucked up my hands on the ice. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it serious? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're broken. A beat. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you up to? STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean in general? In my life? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to say that... STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not asking for anything. I'll be going. I'll call you back to see how Sam's doing. Give him a kiss him from me... 120     ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hang up. STEPHANIE ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hang up! STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't hang up... ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was in a coma for 3 hours... Three hours... For three hours he was dead... I was scared to lose him. His eyes well with tears. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me. STEPHANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't leave you. Black. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: INT. POLAND. HOTEL ROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: A child sleeps. His eyes are darting under his eyelids: vestiges of light and shadow, of noise. Sam opens his eyes: he is in a hotel room. At the foot of the bed, a TV with the sound turned down low is broadcasting a cartoon of mice fighting in Polish. Stephanie comes and goes, picking up things littering the floor and packing their bags. Over these images, we hear Ali's voice: The human hand contains 27 bones. Some monkeys have more: gorillas have 32, five in 121

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: each thumb. For humans, it's 27. If you break an arm or a leg, after a while calcium gathers around the bone and joins it together. In the end, it's stronger than before. But if you break a bone in your hand, you know it'll never fully heal. You'll think about it before every fight. You'll pay attention... And even if you pay attention, the pain will come back... like needles, like broken glass... Ali is wearing a T-shirt. He still bears the marks of yesterday's fight. His eyebrows and hands are bandaged. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, kiddo. It's over. We're going home. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you win? He smiles and kisses his biceps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby of a Holiday Inn, the day after an Ultimate tournament... (much the same ambience as in Turin) The fighters, winners and losers, are about to leave. They greet each other, pose for photographers, answer interviewers, sign autographs... Ali's hands are still bandaged. He is being interviewed along with a kind of Viking with a closed eye and broken arm. Ali goes to join Stephanie and Sam outside the hotel, whe a taxi driver is loading their luggage. A young Polish fa calls out: "Ali! Ali!" He wants a photo. Ali lifts Sam into his arms and pulls Stephanie closer. They pose. THE END
